places_with_reviews.name: Platinum 52 Resort, Bhor - Resort near Pune Mumbai
address: 3km, Bhor, off Ambeghar, Chikhalavade, Maharashtra 412206, India

reviews.text:
A great Resort Platinum 52 at very serene location, go there if you want to relax in nature's lap. When I went to Bhor.. I had plan for only one night's stay as recommended by friends but the location of the resort was perfect, we enjoyed the mountain breeze and chirping of the birds, eventually we extended our stay for one more day. Property has a very safe and secure parking, staff is very polite and helpful. Food is tasty and quality is also great.
We really enjoyed dining in their open air restuarant, enjoying the fresh air.

Our stay at Platinum52 Resort was fantastic! The surroundings are beautiful with mountains nearby. The place has a great vibe and the property is very clean. The rooms are spotless and they take hygiene seriously. I definitely suggest staying here

The view at Platinum Resort is beautiful! The service is great too. The manager, Ram, was really helpful. Everyone there is friendly. Our family had a great time during our 2-day stay. The kids didn't want to leave!

During my recent visit to Platinum 52 Resort near Bhor, I encountered some issues that I believe future visitors should be aware of.

The rooms and toilets weren't as clean as I hoped for, and the overall cleanliness of the resort left something to be desired. Unfortunately, the fun and sports activities advertised were not in working order and seemed neglected in terms of maintenance. The food quality, while not terrible, was only average.

I do want to mention that the resort manager did their best to assist us, but it was evident that they were short-staffed, which affected the overall service and ability to address all our concerns promptly.

In light of my experience, I would caution others to consider alternative options before choosing Platinum 52 Resort for their stay. I hope sharing this feedback helps both future guests and the resort management in making necessary improvements.

We celebrated our marriage anniversary at Platinum 52 and it was awesome experience. Food was nice. Service was excellent. I would like to thank manager Ram and his team for the decorations they did and to make our day special.

places_with_reviews.name: Umber Valley Resort
address: Gat.no.394, At, Post, Natambi, Bhor, Maharashtra 412206, India

reviews.text: The resort stay is worthy. Prices are less, staffs are very good, food is very good. Near by activities like river trekking and hill trek is awesome. They allowed and arranged for us to cook separately too. Night vibe is awesome.

Could have been better but not managed properly.
Tea is horrible, must not try.
Food is below average.
Buttermilk is noting other than water.
Plastic chairs are pathetic. Not good corporate events.

A very good place for a one day picnic
Rates are quite high
Very good veg and non veg food
Unlimited morning breakfast, lunch, evening snacks, high tea/coffee
Swimming pool, indoor and outdoor games, River walk....
Overall good experience
Recommended for family/friends/official get together
Experience was great,  had a very good time in a very rich and green habitat. Food was yummy and tasty. Service was excellent. Staff were very good and cooperative . Worth visiting the resort again

Been to Umber Valley Resort in December with my wife, son and in-laws. The best part of the stay was the great hospitality showed by the Resort staff, the property owner himself who happened to be on the premise on our 1st day and mainly the Meyome representative Dnyandeep.
He ensured that the experience is great not only for me and my wife, but equally for my in-laws who are senior citizens. The actions were proactive without even requesting for it.
The resort was booked by a large corporate group and though the group was one of the most well behaved group I have seen, he ensured that families still have the peace they deserve.
The food was excellent and the staff ensured that the same items are not repeated for guests staying for more than 1 day which needed multiple dishes to be cooked.
The smooth experience started with the booking itself where after hearing out the requirements, Amit from Meyome suggested us the Bhor resort from the other resorts with Meyome.

I would be again visiting the Umber Valley Resort with 32 members of my team next month. Hoping to have a great stay again.

places_with_reviews.name: Rohida Fort- Bajarwadi Grameen Paryatan

reviews.text:
Rohida Fort Trek
My school friend Gopal Mirajkar, his wife Vidya and me did Rohida Fort Trek on Thursday, 10th August 2023. Due to Shrawan Maas (Adhik Shravan) there was exceptionally beautiful nature.... Lush green, cool, play of rains & sun light.... Simply wonderful climate.
Rohida or Vichitragad or Rohideshwar are different names of this fort. It is in village Bajar wadi near Bhor. Just about 68 kms from Pune. We parked car at the base & sarted walking. The climb starts right from Bajar Wadi entrance & slowly keeps becoming steap. We took 1.5 hrs to reach the top. Just near the top, stones & mud had come down due to landslide below Ganesh Darwaja buruj. This was very slippery; but we managed to overcome it. There are different historical sites on the fort like Ganesh Darwaja, ancient water storage, Fatteh buruj, Sarja buruj, Chor darwaja etc. We were in the fort for almost two hours. We saw sites, had food & started decending. We met two youngsters on top. They were quite enthusiastic. We enjoyed their company. Apart from we five, there were no humans on the fort.
Two three dogs accompanied us when we reached top. They were quite friendly and of helping nature. They literaly guided way to us.
It was one of the memorable trek....

Important fort of Maratha Empire, situated near Bhor taluka of Pune district. Fatteh Buruj, sarja buruj, waghjai buruj & patan buruj and some water cisterns are present on fort I'm good condition. Temple of rohidehswar is another place of attraction. 2 lithograph are encraved on wall near the 3 rd entrance. Base Village is Bazaar wadi.

I had a very nice rural immersion experience in Bajarwadi. The fort itself is beautiful, the route to it more so, the people are really caring and helpful and the activities we did with them were an experience of a kind.

The fort is a lovely morning trek, not too difficult (took us an hour, and I'm a rookie). Viewing the sunrise over the hills was a truly breathtaking experience, with gorgeous views all around. The fort at the top is quite grand.
The village itself is very hospitable and welcoming. As part of a homestay, we toured the village, saw the fields and took in the most beautiful night sky. The food is very tasty, fresh and a refreshing change from the usual.
It's very nice fort#awesome environment#beautiful nature in rainy season#mind refreshing one day trip from Pune....

places_with_reviews.name: Rohida Fort/Vichitragad hotel (हाॅटेल रोहिडा-Hotel Rohida)
address: A/P Bajarwadi , Tal, Dist, Bhor, Bajarwadi, Maharashtra 412206, India

reviews.text: We visited in Nov of 2023. Road conditions (from Pune) are excellent except for small bad patches, so no worries for sedans or low slung cars. This is not very popular, hence go only on a weekend so that you have some co-trekkers. The best time to go is oct first week to view the lush greenery, any later is not that great. Absolutely nothing en route, so pack water and snacks. Parking is safe and Rs 50 for cars, available at the trek starting point.
Fantastic fort, one day trek from Pune.About 55 ka from Pune.Takes around two hours to climb, an hour to see the fort.
Simple, Best nd classic fort.. atmosphere is too good specially in rainy season
Hotel Rohida is very descent ...and Natural Place ..one can enjoy the bliss ..
Awesome
